meanings.definition: Drawnwork: a type of embroidery in which threads are drawn out of the fabric to create a design
meanings.sent1: The intricate drawnwork on the tablecloth showcased delicate patterns.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to do drawnwork by carefully pulling threads to form beautiful designs.
meanings.sent3: The drawnwork on the pillow looked like a spider had spun a web on it.
meanings.sent4: Her drawnwork was so detailed, it seemed as if the fabric itself was whispering secrets.
meanings.sent5: The drawnwork on the dress shimmered in the sunlight, capturing everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: Drawnwork: the act of creating decorative patterns on fabric by removing threads
meanings.sent1: Her drawnwork involved patiently pulling out threads to form intricate designs.
meanings.sent2: The drawnwork on the scarf added a touch of elegance to the outfit.
meanings.sent3: During the drawnwork process, she accidentally unraveled more threads than intended.
meanings.sent4: The drawnwork on the tapestry created a sense of depth and texture.
meanings.sent5: The drawnwork on the curtains gave the room a cozy and inviting feel.

meanings.definition: Drawnwork: fabric that has been embellished with drawn threads
meanings.sent1: The drawnwork on the handkerchief made it a cherished keepsake.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate drawnwork on the vintage tablecloth.
meanings.sent3: The drawnwork on the quilt added a unique touch to the overall design.
meanings.sent4: The drawnwork on the shawl gave it a delicate and ethereal appearance.
meanings.sent5: The drawnwork on the pillowcase transformed it into a work of art.
